"Rescued by my courage, she must be mine"

# BITSY VERSION 3.5

! ROOM_FORMAT 1

PAL 0
0,0,0
192,192,192
255,255,255

ROOM 0

ROOM 2
c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c,c

END undefined 5,4

POS 2 2,7

DLG 10
Well, what are you waiting for?

DLG a
Welcome to the land of the gorgons. The cave is that way.

DLG b
We speak for her.

DLG c
believe it or not I know what it is to turn into stone.

DLG d
I know what it is to feel someone's eyes burn into yours.

DLG e
you turn and look into their eyes and they gaze like burning embers

DLG f
and if you knew better, you would cry out, but you don't, you fall silent. 

DLG g
you stand there stock still and everything freezes, even though you should fight or run or kick or scream. You should know better, shouldn't you?

DLG h
but surely you know all that, don't you, my brave hero?

DLG i
I was beautiful once... I know that is hard to believe.

DLG j
I was beautiful once, I know that is hard to believe. 

DLG k
but I wanted to be more than beautiful. I wanted to devote my life to something bigger than that. 

DLG l
I wanted my life to be important. Mortal lives have to be important. 

DLG m
I wanted to serve. Unlike my sisters, well willing to sleep for years for nothing. That's why I chose to serve the goddess Athena. 

DLG n
The goddess of wisdom- that seemed worthy. 

DLG o
She liked her girls, chaste and so I was. I only thought of her, of being a vessel for her. 

DLG p
I thought, I could be so much more for her. 

DLG q
Then one night, I was there late in the temple, I know I shouldn't have been but it was so peaceful at night

DLG r
kind of like it is now, kind of like how it is here. I remember the cool marble underneath my feet. 

DLG s
Then, I heard HIM behind me... and you know the rest? That's why you're here isn't it?

DLG t
but really.. what he did to me in that temple hurt, but what turned me into stone really wasn't him, it was her, turning away from me. 

DLG u
the goddess, in all of her wisdom, could not believe I was innocent

DLG v
Ovid, in all of his wisdom will say I'm a skank that deserves that ugliness inside and out

DLG w
and you... why are you here? To save a damsel?

DLG x
if her father wanted to save her, they would, you know that right?

DLG y
but they don't want to-- it's really one monster or the next

DLG z
how the hell do you know if she even wants to be saved?

END 0


END undefined
You slice off her head, and a winged horse crawls out of her carcass, and like an echo, her voice says,
